header.gameNote: ATLANTIC SUN TR AT JOHNSON CITY TN

article.description:
Boomer Herndon and Josh Goodwin each scored 15 points to lead Belmont to a 72-59 victory over Stetson in the semifinals of the Atlantic Sun basketball tournament at
Memorial Center on Friday night.
article.headline: Belmont coach Byrd picks up 400th victory
article.linkText: Belmont advances with win over Stetson
article.story: JOHNSON CITY, Tenn. (AP) -- Boomer Herndon and Josh Goodwin each scored 15 points to lead Belmont to a 72-59 victory over Stetson in the semifinals of the Atlantic Sun basketball tournament at Memorial Center on Friday night. Belmont (19-10) advanced to Saturday's championship game at 2 p.m. EST against crosstown Nashville rival Lipscomb, which defeated Gardner-Webb 70-51. The winner earns an NCAA berth. It was Coach Rick Byrd's 400th win in his 20th season at Belmont. Stetson, which was 2-16 at one point this season and finished 14-18, continued its hot late-season play. The Hatters stayed even with the Bruins throughout the first half, and pulled within one at 25-24 with 4:26 to go. Lipscomb responded by scoring the last five points of the half, capped by Justin Hare's leaning 18-footer that landed hard on the back of the rim and then rolled into the net. Belmont struggled to gain distance from Stetson until Andy Wicke made a 3-pointer with 7:34 to go in the game, giving the Bruins a 52-42 edge. Stetson cut the lead to six, 54-48, on a 3-pointer by Karl Hollingsworth with 3:28 remaining. However, Goodwin hit a 3-pointer from the corner at 3:03 and Justin Hare followed 37 seconds later with a basket to make it 59-48. Belmont also got 13 points from Wicke and 12 from Hare. Herndon led with nine rebounds. Hollingsworth finished with a career-high 24 points for Stetson, which also got 15 points from E.J. Gordon and 11 from Anthony Register. Hollingsworth and Register each had eight rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
